NOTES: The input port is the one connecting the PDU to the wall or UPS. Cable labelling for wall connections is not supported by this application.

DESCRIPTIONS 2: Fill this in for single load segment (or when each load segment has exactly one port); also fill this in when entering management port or input port.

NOTES: The extensions bar can only be placed vertically (left or right).
The input port is the one connecting to a PDU or UPS. Labelling this connection is supported by application.

DESCRIPTIONS 2: power port number belonging to given segment

DESCRIPTIONS 1: Fill this in when entering management port.

NOTES: When filling in the KVM port the user can enter ‘-’ as input for port number (not mandatory but easiest choice).

DESCRIPTIONS 1: Fill this in when entering management port.
A chassis contains several slots each one being an independent server
NOTES: The label of the scalable server is similar to the one of the rackmount server the only difference being the slot number.
One slot means one independent server node located within scalable server chassis. The node has its own power supplies and management port.

DESCRIPTIONS 2: Fill this in when entering management port.
data module, management module or power supply (port) number
NOTES: data module can be an Ethernet switch, SAN switch etc
uplink port connects management modules to the ones of next enclosure; for this module type the user can enter ‘-’ for module number (not mandatory but easiest choice)
downlink port connects to uplink port of previous enclosure; for this module type the user can enter ‘-’ for module number (not mandatory but easiest choice)
the power port number is given in the module number, not in the port number (latter one used only for data ports)
port number parameter is ignored for any module except data module; the user could enter ‘-’ (not mandatory but easiest choice)

DESCRIPTIONS 2: data port, specific type  (FC, SAS) not explicitly provided
NOTES: When a single (unified) management port is used please fill in ‘M’ both for controller number and port number.
When dedicated management ports are used (one per controller), please fill in a positive integer for controller number and ‘M’ for port number.

DESCRIPTIONS 2: Fill this in when entering management port (no matter if unified or per controller).

DESCRIPTIONS 1: A chassis contains several blades. Each blade has several networking ports.
NOTES: All blades share the same pool of power supplies. Management port is also per chassis.

DESCRIPTIONS 1: Fill this in when entering power supplies or management port.

DESCRIPTIONS 1: Fill this in when entering management port.
A chassis contains several blades. Each blade has several data ports of one or more types.
NOTES: All blades share the same pool of power supplies. Management port is also per chassis.

DESCRIPTIONS 1: Fill this in when entering power supplies or management port.

*DEVICE TYPE*: - any entered text values are case insensitive
- if an input parameter does not exist or is not used please enter '-' (avoid empty fields). See next point for the case when this character is mandatory as input parameter value.

- in specific cases it is mandatory to enter '-' for some parameters. For example for servers or switches when the management port should be connected the user should enter '-' for port type and 'm' for port number.
- columns with headers enclosed by '*' contain values that can be entered by user in the connection input file
- each device type can also be entered in the connection definitions file at the required U position(s)
